Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: The lawyer refused to be drawn into such a shady case.
sentences.chinese: 這位律師拒絕被拉入這種不明不白的事情中去。

sentences.english: The development that America achieved over the last 4 centuries did not exactly come clean.
sentences.chinese: 但是近4個世紀美國的發展都是來得不明不白的。

sentences.english: Choose, but this background is ambiguous, the nature is a many people disapproved of.
sentences.chinese: 選，可是這來歷不明不白的，自然是有很多人反對的。

sentences.english: Your speech didn't come across; nobody understood your opinion.
sentences.chinese: 你的演說講得不明不白，沒有人能聽懂你的意思。

sentences.english: The most head-scratchingly silly of all are the story's plot.
sentences.chinese: 這其中最傻得讓人不明不白的是故事的情節。

sentences.english: Time flies away without anything left in this way.
sentences.chinese: 時間就這樣不明不白地流走了。

sentences.english: We couldn't lose that game without feeling very hurt about it.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能就這麼不明不白的輸掉比賽。

definition: variant of 糊裡糊塗|糊里糊涂[hu2 li5 hu2 tu2]
muddleheaded/careless
to feel vexed/annoyed/good-for-nothing/stupid and cowardly
without good cause
to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
to say definitely/to commit (to a proposition)
dead but will not close the eyes (idiom); to die with a remaining grievance
violent death (idiom); to die in a disaster/an unnatural death
not reconciled to/not resigned to

to die in tragic circumstances
to accuse wrongly/to treat unjustly/injustice/wronged/not worthwhile
perfectly all right/without rhyme or reason
to die by violence
ending up as/leading to/resulting in/in total
